newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: S.African August M3 money supply grows 15.51 pct.
newsitem.headline: S.African August M3 money supply grows 15.51 pct.

text.p: South Africa's year-on-year broadly defined M3 money supply grew 15.51 percent in August, preliminary Reserve Bank figures show.
July M3 growth was revised to 14.72 percent from a preliminary 14.69 percent.
Annual private sector credit growth was 17.71 percent, preliminary figures showed, against a revised 18.61 percent in July.
A Reuters consensus poll of economists forecast money supply would rise 15.7 percent year-on-year, while private sector credit extension was expected to rise 17.9 percent.
August 1996 preliminary private sector credit growth -- 17.71 percent
M3 annualised growth rate from base of guideline
